verses.plain: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

tokens.t: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

verses.plain: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

tokens.t: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

verses.plain: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

tokens.t: mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

verses.plain: ¶ Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.

tokens.t: beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as

verses.plain: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

tokens.t: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair
as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

verses.plain: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.

tokens.t: as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and

verses.plain: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

tokens.t: As a piece of a pomegranate

verses.plain: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

tokens.t: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

verses.plain: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

tokens.t: of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her;
, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

verses.plain: ¶ Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?

tokens.t: looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun,

verses.plain: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.

tokens.t: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley,
to see whether the vine flourished,

verses.plain: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.

tokens.t: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me

verses.plain: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.

tokens.t: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.

footnotes.text: Or ever…: Heb. I knew not
made…: or, set me on the chariots of my willing people
